hero.question: Will US or Israel strike Iran first?
hero.prob_take: The 6.5-point dump signals genuine relief that neither side escalated after Israel's October strikes, with money exiting the position as the immediate crisis window closes. At 31%, traders are overpricing the restraint narrative when Iran's retaliation math hasn't changed, meaning asymmetric upside exists if Tehran follows through on promised responses.

daily_take.headline: Iran Strike Odds Crater 6.5 Points. Smart Money Sees De-Escalation.
daily_take.deck: The US-Israel Iran strike market tanked from 37.7% to 31.2% in 24 hours on $1.4M volume, signaling a sharp consensus shift toward cooling tensions. This isn't noise. Major bettors are reading the room better than cable news, and the remaining 31% still looks fat for anyone holding the under. Watch for any escalation rhetoric to fade fast, which means fading this price too.

sidebar.headline: German Greens party just printed a 26-point rally. Check if this reflects actual polling momentum or pure speculation that hasn't caught up to reality yet.
sidebar.label: German Greens 2026: 36.2%

sidebar.headline: Duke got absolutely demolished in betting markets. A 29.5-point crater in 24 hours screams sharp money fled this position hard. The real play might be sniffing out why.
sidebar.label: Duke Moneyline: 3.0%

sidebar.headline: Anduril IPO odds dropped 22 points. Defense contractors facing funding headwinds, or is the market just repricing 2027 timelines downward across the board?
sidebar.label: Anduril IPO Before 2027: 25.0%
